intro: Paullinia panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian soursop, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces a large, spiny fruit that is typically harvested when fully mature. Its botanical features include rough, fissured bark and a strong, aromatic scent. Paullinia panamensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
